metadata.name: Pazyryk and The Wild Horse.
metadata.description:
The Wild horse is too old so is The Rug. Pazyryk is one of the oldest carpets in the world, dating around 4thâ€“3rd centuries BC. The origin of the rug is unknown. It may have originated between the Iranian-Altaian corridor through ancient contacts. Some authors assume that the wool, the artistic conception, as well as the workmanship, may have been provided by Armenians of the Near East.

During Researches about The rugs I accidentally discovered that Rotting weaves of Pazyryk goes Simultaneously with rotting life, and the weaver is dead for long (!)
